chapter.title: Inventory of Base Permissions
chapter.para: The following table gives the full inventory of the individual permissions required to access modules and lists, to select transactions from a list, to open the input screens and to execute the various actions available in .

These individual base permissions are available to create Roles (in the Role Maintenance Module), Roles being sets of these base permissions. Since banks are also responsible for role definition and preparation for their customers, the full inventory of permissions is given, for both bank middle-office and customer features.
Whenever an authorisation is required in , the corresponding base permission is checked. User interactions are categorised into different Types:

listitem.para: Menu access(M): when a specific permission is required to view the menu or submenu.
List access (L): when a specific permission is required to be presented a list (e.g.: list of pending LCs).
Screen access (S): when a specific permission is required to access the form (e.g.: LC input form).
Action (A): for push buttons (e.g.: LC input form Save button).

section.title: On the customer side
section.para: The home page has the following links to the product modules:

entry.para: Trade Applications Modules available in the Customer Home Page
Import Letter of Credit (link available to this module)
Export Letter of Credit (link available to this module)
Financing Requests (link available to this module)
Banker's Garantee (link available to this module)
Export Collection (link available to this module)
Import Collection (link available to this module)
Issued Standby LC (link available to this module)
Received Standby LC (link available to this module)
Fund Transfer (link available to this module)
Inward Remittance (link available to this module)
Trade Message Center (link available to this module)
Indeed all users are at least granted access to the Change Password feature.
Within the Help popup that topic accessed will depend on the user permissions.
Remark: lc_access is a prerequisite to reach the LC module.

entry.para: Note that lc_access, sg_access, tf_access and el_access are the additional permissions required to see the respective product transactions records in the list.
The list of reporting messages from the bank as seen in the Home page of the customer is also affected by these permissions.
